result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramon Migel Martinez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Domestic Abuse Repeater - Domestic Abuse Surcharge/10 Years], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Domestic Abuse Repeater - Domestic Abuse Surcharge/10 Years], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with Count 2, consecutive to any sentence now being served.

miscConds.notes: $618 costs - DOC collect.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with Virgen Rogas unless approved by agent.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC collect any unpaid financial obligations.

Defendant Ramon Migel Martinez in court with attorney Philip J. Brehm.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Counts 1 and 2; Court finds defendant guilty. Court orders 3 years probation each count, concurrent with each other, consecutive to any sentence now being served, no contact with V.R. unless approved by agent, costs $1236 - DOC collect, no sentence credit.
